SQL> 
SQL> REM DATE FUNCTIONS :
SQL> 
SQL> REM DATE FUNCTIONS + DATE ARITHMETICS
SQL> 
SQL> REM LIST OF DATE FUNCTIONS : SYSDATE CURRENT_DATE   ADD_MONTHS MONTHS_BETWEEN   LAST_DAY NEXT_DAY    TRUNC ROUND
SQL> 
SQL> REM SYSDATE : RETURNS SERVER MACHINE'S DATE AND TIME INFO.
SQL> 
SQL> REM CURRENT_DATE : RETURNS CLIENT MACHINE'S DATE AND TIME INFO.
SQL> 
SQL> 
SQL> SELECT CURRENT_DATE , SYSDATE FROM DUAL;

CURRENT_D SYSDATE                                                                                                                                                                                       
--------- ---------                                                                                                                                                                                     
17-JUL-23 17-JUL-23                                                                                                                                                                                     

SQL> REM DATE DEFAULT FORMAT IS : DD-MON-RR
SQL> 
SQL> REM TO SEE PARAMETER'S DEFAULT VALUE : NLS_SESSION_PARAMETERS
SQL> 
SQL> SELECT * FROM NLS_SESSION_PARAMETERS;

SQL> 
SQL> REM DATE VALUES ARE STORED IN 7 VALUES : 20       23     7       17          15          19       0
SQL> 
SQL> 
SQL> REM DATE ARITHMETICS : 1 DATE +/- ALL ABOVE INTERVALS = DATE   2  DATE - DATE =  DAYS
SQL> 
SQL> 
SQL> REM DATE VALUE IS STORED IN 7 PARTS/INTERVALS/COMPONENTS :
SQL> 
SQL> REM WE CAN ADD OR SUBTRACT EACH OF THEM TO/FROM DATE VALUE.
SQL>
